text: TDD - beginner problems and stumbling blocks
While I've written unit tests for most of the code I've done, I only recently got my hands on a copy of TDD by example by Kent Beck.
I have always regretted certain design decisions I made since they prevented the application from being 'testable'.

I read through the book and while some of it looks alien, I felt that I could manage it and decided to try it out on my current project which is basically a client/server system where the two pieces communicate via.
One on the gadget and the other on the host.
I started off and very soon got entangled in a mess of rewrites and tiny tests which I later figured didn't really test anything.
I threw away most of them and and now have a working application for which the tests have all coagulated into just 2.
Based on my experiences, I have a few questions which I'd like to ask.

I gained some information from http://stackoverflow.com/questions/1146218/new-to-tdd-are-there-sample-applications-with-tests-to-show-how-to-do-tdd but have some specific questions which I'd like answers to/discussion on.
I'm looking for comments and advice from people who have implemented large non trivial projects completely (or almost completely) using this methodology.
It makes sense to me to follow the way after I have something already running and want to add a new feature but doing it from scratch seems to tiresome and not worth the effort.
